intro: Dalea enneandra var. pumila, commonly known as the plains Dalea, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, elongated seed pods. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
